article_title: Japan Hostage Crisis Prompts Questioning of New Policy
article_text:
TOKYO—After the apparent brutal killings of two Japanese hostages, opposition leaders Monday began to question more openly whether Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s plans for expanding the role of the country’s military in international security would place more Japanese citizens in danger.

Mr. Abe wants Japan to adopt a more muscular military posture and play a greater role in international affairs. Last year, his cabinet revised its interpretation of a key article of the nation’s constitution, determining that it allows...
